So don't immediately assume, oh this kid is this way because he's the naughty kid
or this kid or this kid is this way because he's LGBTI.
Get rid of the labels. Kids are kids and we actually don't know what's going on behind the scenes at home and in their lives.
So we need to treat them as humans.
Because what happens with a lot of their young people is they hear words around them,
words in the playground, all that's so gay and it's meant as a negative.

I chop them out in my life. They might be a trouble lying by that parent because they're

takes it on board and takes it to their heart.
